chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell D Wallace Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Sexual Exploitation - Employ,Use,Induce (by Person Under 18 Years of Age), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.05(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended - Must be Co-signed by Dawn McNew. Must reside @107 Sara Lane #16, Mauston, WI 53948. No contact with victim #1 - dob 1-31-2002 or residence. No contact with anyone  under the age of 18 years except at employment at mcdonalds. Allow employment at Mcdonalds  if supervised by someone over the age of 18 years. Remain in the city of Mauston while case is pending. Restrict travel to city of Mauston. Not to use any device that allows access to the Internet. Must report to Juneau County Sheriff Dept. every Sunday@ 9:00 am. May attend Safety travel school outside Juneau Co., must go directly to and from. May do yard work outside the city of Mauston and be transported by Grandmother D. Mcnew and know what hours. Hours should be 8- 3:15 pm. Monday -Friday. No contact with anyone under the age of 18 yrs.

Defendant Darrell D Wallace in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Jake A Westman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Judge colloques the defendant. Information filed - Pre-trial scheduled for 11-20-14 @ 9 am, Defense moves to modify conditions of the bond - Request defendant be allowed to attend traffic school outside the Co., be allowed to do yard work outside the city limits of mauston. State opposes the yard work -  Judge - Grants motion to modify bond to include attending traffic school outside Juneau Co., must go directly to and from. May also do yard work for individuals outside Mauston city limits and be transported to and from by grandmother D. McNew and she must know the hours he is working. Hours are to be 8-3:15 Monday-Friday and no contact with anyone under the age of 18 yrs. Not guilty's entered - Pre-trial scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
